page.title: 05HOUSING IN MADDERTY
page.content: { Village of St. David's St. David's is a small village of 25 houses where 40 people live. They are mainly single storey houses,two are cottage-type and two are two-storey. Of these 19 are private houses and 6 are council houses. Four of the houses are holiday homes. All the houses have very large gardens separated from their front doors by the main road through the village. The village was built in 1832 by Lady Baird in memory of her husband Sir David Baird,a famous soldier. She also built a school in 1835. This is now a private house. In the centre of the village is the Guild Hall,built in 1919 where clubs meet and local functions are held.
